sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Handwritten postcard from Harden to Schenker, dated March 1, 1894
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: Harden sends greetings to Schenker and [Adolph?] Gelber; he encourages Schenker to add mention of Hans von Bülow to his upcoming article on conductors, and asks Schenker to perform a thorough revision because the draft was not entirely clear.
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: Harden, Maximilian; Schenker, Heinrich; Gelber; Bülow, Hans von; proofs

tei:p.tei:hi: Handwritten postcard from Harden to Schenker, postmarked March 1, 1894

tei:transcription.tei:p: {recto} [preprinted form with handwritten address information] Deutsche Reichspost Postkarte
An [/] Herrn Dr. H. Schenker in Wien Wohnung III Fraungasse 1.
Ihnen und Gelber Probably the scholar of German language and literature, Adolph Gelber (1856-1923). herzlichen Dank u. Grüß.

Wenn Sie wollen, setzen Sie Gefl. in der Korrektur These are probably the proofs for “Konzertdirigenten,” which appeared in Die Zukunft on April 14, 1894, and is reprinted in Hellmut Federhofer, Heinrich Schenker als Essayist und Kritiker (Hildesheim: Georg Olms Verlag, 1990), pp. 75–82. noch einiges über Bülow Click on Hans von Bülow, a personal acquaintance of Harden’s who had died on February 12, 1894. hinzu, es wäre wohl gut.
Auch sonst bitte um genau Durchsicht, mir war nicht Alles klar.

tei:translation.tei:p: {recto} [preprinted form with handwritten address information] German Imperial Post Postcard
To Dr. H. Schenker in Vienna Address III Fraungasse 1.
[postmark:] || Berlin W. c | 9 | 1/3 | 94 | 5½-6PM || [postmark, upside-down:] || Vienna 3/3 | 49 | Delivered | 2.-3.94 | 6PM ||
Sincere thanks and greetings to you and Gelber.
If you like, it would probably be good if you would kindly add something on the proof about Bülow.
In addition, please, a thorough review; not everything was clear to me.
